##

CVE-2024-5430
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

4 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.695Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

CVE-2024-3959
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

4 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.695Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

CVE-2024-39459
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-26T20:07:12

2 posts

When creating secret file credentials Plain Credentials Plugin 182.v468b_97b_9dcb_8 and earlier attempts to decrypt the content of the file to check if it constitutes a valid encrypted secret. In rare cases the file content matches the expected format of an encrypted secret, and the file content will be stored unencrypted (only Base64 encoded) on the Jenkins controller file system. These credenti

CVE-2024-39458
(3.1 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-26T20:03:46

2 posts

Structs Plugin provides utility functionality used, e.g., in Pipeline to instantiate and configure build steps, typically before their execution. When Structs Plugin 337.v1b_04ea_4df7c8 and earlier fails to configure a build step, it logs a warning message containing diagnostic information that may contain secrets passed as step parameters. This can result in accidental exposure of secrets throu

CVE-2024-27867(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-26T06:30:29

14 posts

An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in AirPods Firmware Update 6A326, AirPods Firmware Update 6F8, and Beats Firmware Update 6F8. When your headphones are seeking a connection request to one of your previously paired devices, an attacker in Bluetooth range might be able to spoof the intended source device and gain access to your headphones.

There’s a security vulnerability (CVE-2024-27867) in the firmware of #Apple #airpods Anyone who knows the Bluetooth MAC address (which is somewhat public) can connect to your AirPods and listen to the microphone or play music.

https://www.rockwellautomation.com/en-us/trust-center/security-advisories/advisory.SD1677.html

##

CVE-2024-5988(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T18:31:22

1 posts

Due to an improper input validation, an unauthenticated threat actor can send a malicious message to invoke a local or remote executable and cause a remote code execution condition on the Rockwell Automation ThinManager® ThinServer™.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-26T04:21:19.953Z ##

Critical : CVE-2024-5988, CVE-2024-5989 :
Upgrade your Rockwell Automation ThinManager ThinServer NOW!! #SCADA
CVSS Score v3/v4 : 9.8/9.3

Advisory:
https://www.rockwellautomation.com/en-us/trust-center/security-advisories/advisory.SD1677.html

##

CVE-2024-5806
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:18

28 posts

Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios.This issue affects MOVEit Transfer: from 2023.0.0 before 2023.0.11, from 2023.1.0 before 2023.1.6, from 2024.0.0 before 2024.0.2.

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/watchTowr-vs-progress-moveit_CVE-2024-5806

catc0n at 2024-07-01T23:44:20.810Z ##

Rapid7 analysis of #MOVEit Transfer #CVE_2024_5806 c/o @stephenfewer, with an assist from @fuzz. Notably, this exploit method is different from the one published last week — Rapid7's exploit achieves the auth bypass by manipulating the username supplied client-side during the SSH protocol's public key auth exchange with the server. As a result, both exploitability and IOCs are different. This also doesn't rely on what appears to be a new 0day for exploitation, though that was an interesting (if surprising) method.
https://attackerkb.com/topics/44EZLG2xgL/cve-2024-5806/rapid7-analysis

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T18:29:24.293Z ##

Progress Software security advisories:

  • MOVEit Gateway Critical Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5805): CVE-2024-5805 (9.1 critical) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Gateway (SFTP module) allows Authentication Bypass.
  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)
  • Customers using the MOVEit Cloud environment were patched and are no longer vulnerable to this exploit. (CVE-2024-5806)

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_5805 #CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #Moveit #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:21:48.529Z ##

watchTowr: Auth. Bypass In (Un)Limited Scenarios - Progress MOVEit Transfer (CVE-2024-5806)
Hot off the press! cc: @cR0w @mttaggart
CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios.
watchTowr provides additional information (and what looks like a proof of concept exploit code) in their deep dive:

The vulnerability arises from the interplay between MOVEit and IPWorks SSH, and a failure to handle an error condition.

Progress quietly emailed MOVEit customers about an "auth bypass in SFTP" around 13 June 2024. Information about CVE-2024-5806 was embargoed until today 25 June 2024.

#CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T18:29:24.000Z ##

Progress Software security advisories:

  • MOVEit Gateway Critical Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5805): CVE-2024-5805 (9.1 critical) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Gateway (SFTP module) allows Authentication Bypass.
  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)
  • Customers using the MOVEit Cloud environment were patched and are no longer vulnerable to this exploit. (CVE-2024-5806)

AAKL at 2024-06-28T14:58:43.062Z ##

US Department of Health and Human Services Issues Alert on Critical Vulnerability in ‘MOVEit,’ File Transfer Platform Used by Health Care Sector https://www.aha.org/advisory/2024-06-28-hhs-issues-alert-critical-vulnerability-moveit-file-transfer-platform-used-health-care-sector #cybersecurity #infosec #moveit

##
mle at 2024-06-26T15:11:11.015Z ##

As of 7:15 PM ET 6/25, Progress Software updated the CVSS score of CVE-2024-5806 (auth bypass in MOVEit Transfer) from a 7.4 (HIGH) to 9.1 (CRITICAL).

Their advisory now includes reporting on additional "newly identified" vulnerabilities in a third-party component used by MOVEit Transfer. The original patch for CVE-2024-5806 does not mitigate these issues, and Progress urges customers to:

➡️ Block inbound RDP access to MOVEit Transfer
➡️ Limit outbound access to only trusted servers

https://community.progress.com/s/article/MOVEit-Transfer-Product-Security-Alert-Bulletin-June-2024-CVE-2024-5806

#MOVEit #security

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T14:41:00.652Z ##

@cR0w @mttaggart if you can provide some evidence of hands-on-keyboard exploitation attempts, CVE-2024-5806 could be added to CISA's KEV Catalog.

@censys also came to the same assessment: Organizations who were victims to the previous mass exploitation of CVE-2023-34362 are likely the same ones at risk for CVE-2024-5806: https://censys.com/moveit-transfer-auth-bypass/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-06-26T12:30:52.467Z ##

The new bug (CVE-2024-5806, CVSS: 7.4) is an improper authentication vulnerability in MOVEit's SFTP module that "can lead to authentication bypass in limited scenarios," according to Progress. https://www.darkreading.com/remote-workforce/fresh-moveit-bug-under-attack-disclosure

##

##
mle at 2024-06-26T00:00:50.183Z ##

*cracks knuckles*

Okay, here we go.

On June 25, 2024, Progress Software disclosed two auth bypass vulnerabilities in the SFTP module of their #MOVEit software:

✴️ CVE-2024-5806, in MOVEit Transfer (CVSS 7.4)
✴️ CVE-2024-5085, in MOVEit Gateway (CVSS 9.1)

We took this opportunity to examine MOVEit Transfer exposure, roughly one year after Clop began a mass exploitation campaign against the file transfer software.

More details in our blog ⤵️
https://censys.com/moveit-transfer-auth-bypass/

#CensysResearch #security

*cracks knuckles*

Okay, here we go.

On June 25, 2024, Progress Software disclosed two auth bypass vulnerabilities in the SFTP module of their #MOVEit software:

✴️ CVE-2024-5806, in MOVEit Transfer (CVSS 7.4)
✴️ CVE-2024-5085, in MOVEit Gateway (CVSS 9.1)

We took this opportunity to examine MOVEit Transfer exposure, roughly one year after Clop began a mass exploitation campaign against the file transfer software.

https://censys.com/moveit-transfer-auth-bypass/

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T18:13:55.000Z ##

Progress Software has patched one critical (CVE-2024-5805) and one high-risk (CVE-2024-5806) vulnerability in MOVEit, its widely used managed file transfer (MFT) software product.

WatchTowr has outlined an exploit chain for CVE-2024-5806 and has published a PoC.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/06/25/cve-2024-5805-cve-2024-5806/

##

CVE-2021-4440(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:17

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: x86/xen: Drop USERGS_SYSRET64 paravirt call commit afd30525a659ac0ae0904f0cb4a2ca75522c3123 upstream. USERGS_SYSRET64 is used to return from a syscall via SYSRET, but a Xen PV guest will nevertheless use the IRET hypercall, as there is no sysret PV hypercall defined. So instead of testing all the prerequisites for doing a sysr

hnbot@chrispelli.fun at 2024-06-30T04:39:38.000Z ##

CVE-2021-4440: A Linux CNA Case Study - https://grsecurity.net/cve-2021-4440_linux_cna_case_study

#hackernews

##
ycombinator@rss-mstdn.studiofreesia.com at 2024-06-30T01:31:47.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-37085
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:17

1 posts

VMware ESXi contains an authentication bypass vulnerability. A malicious actor with sufficient Active Directory (AD) permissions can gain full access to an ESXi host that was previously configured to use AD for user management https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2012/09/joining-vsphere-hosts-to-active-directory.html by re-creating the configured AD group ('ESXi Admins' by default) after it was dele

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T16:04:42.000Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0013:VMware ESXi and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37085, CVE-2024-37086, CVE-2024-37087)
VMware ESXi, vCenter Server and Cloud Foundation updates address multiple vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-37085 (6.8 medium) VMware ESXi Active Directory Integration Authentication Bypass
  • CVE-2024-37086 (6.8 medium) VMware ESXi out-of-bounds read vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-37087 (5.3 medium) VMware vCenter denial-of-service vulnerability

No mention of exploitation. Screw Broadcom for making these hard to find.

#CVE_2024_37085 #CVE_2024_37086 #CVE_2024_37087 #vmware #esxi #vcenter #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2024-37087
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:17

1 posts

The vCenter Server contains a denial-of-service vulnerability. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may create a denial-of-service condition.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T16:04:42.000Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0013:VMware ESXi and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37085, CVE-2024-37086, CVE-2024-37087)
VMware ESXi, vCenter Server and Cloud Foundation updates address multiple vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-37085 (6.8 medium) VMware ESXi Active Directory Integration Authentication Bypass
  • CVE-2024-37086 (6.8 medium) VMware ESXi out-of-bounds read vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-37087 (5.3 medium) VMware vCenter denial-of-service vulnerability

No mention of exploitation. Screw Broadcom for making these hard to find.

##

CVE-2024-37086
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:17

1 posts

VMware ESXi contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine with an existing snapshot may trigger an out-of-bounds read leading to a denial-of-service condition of the host.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T16:04:42.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-37085 (6.8 medium) VMware ESXi Active Directory Integration Authentication Bypass
  • CVE-2024-37086 (6.8 medium) VMware ESXi out-of-bounds read vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-37087 (5.3 medium) VMware vCenter denial-of-service vulnerability

updated 2024-06-25T15:31:10

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T18:29:24.000Z ##

Progress Software security advisories:

  • MOVEit Gateway Critical Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5805): CVE-2024-5805 (9.1 critical) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Gateway (SFTP module) allows Authentication Bypass.
  • MOVEit Transfer Product Security Alert Bulletin – June 2024 – (CVE-2024-5806): CVE-2024-5806 (7.4 high) An Improper Authentication vulnerability in Progress MOVEit Transfer (SFTP module) can lead to Authentication Bypass in limited scenarios. Proof of concept available, see parent toot above.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. Both vulnerabilities were patched. Notes:

  • MOVEit Cloud does not use MOVEit Gateway, so no further action is needed by MOVEit Cloud customers. (CVE-2024-5805)
  • Customers using the MOVEit Cloud environment were patched and are no longer vulnerable to this exploit. (CVE-2024-5806)

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_5805 #CVE_2024_5806 #Progress #Moveit #vulnerability #CVE

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T18:13:55.000Z ##

Progress Software has patched one critical (CVE-2024-5805) and one high-risk (CVE-2024-5806) vulnerability in MOVEit, its widely used managed file transfer (MFT) software product.

WatchTowr has outlined an exploit chain for CVE-2024-5806 and has published a PoC.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/06/25/cve-2024-5805-cve-2024-5806/

#Cybersecurity #CVE #MOVEitTransfer

In PHP versions 8.1.* before 8.1.29, 8.2.* before 8.2.20, 8.3.* before 8.3.8, when using Apache and PHP-CGI on Windows, if the system is set up to use certain code pages, Windows may use "Best-Fit" behavior to replace characters in command line given to Win32 API functions. PHP CGI module may misinterpret those characters as PHP options, which may allow a malicious user to pass options to PHP bina

shellsharks@shellsharks.social at 2024-06-25T17:50:14.000Z ##

These “named" vulnerabilities are really getting out of control. New drop from Eclypsium “UEFICANHAZBUFFEROVERFLOW” (i.e. CVE-2024-0762) is a vuln in the Phoenix SecureCore UEFI firmware. #cve20240762

Go read more about it on their site https://eclypsium.com/blog/ueficanhazbufferoverflow-widespread-impact-from-vulnerability-in-popular-pc-and-server-firmware/.

For this, and all other named vulns, I've been keeping tracking of them since 2019: https://shellsharks.com/designer-vulnerabilities

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-24T12:12:08.000Z ##

CVE-2024-37032(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-17T15:16:54

3 posts

Ollama before 0.1.34 does not validate the format of the digest (sha256 with 64 hex digits) when getting the model path, and thus mishandles the TestGetBlobsPath test cases such as fewer than 64 hex digits, more than 64 hex digits, or an initial `../` substring.

##

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.79%

updated 2024-06-13T19:34:00

8 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

Nuclei template

11 repos

https://github.com/cmsec423/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/ArturArz1/TestCVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/cmsec423/Magento-XXE-CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2024-34102-CosmicSting-XXE-in-Adobe-Commerce-and-Magento

https://github.com/dr3u1d/CVE-2024-34102-RCE

https://github.com/11whoami99/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/th3gokul/CVE-2024-34102

https://github.com/0x0d3ad/CVE-2024-34102

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T14:03:42.391Z ##

AssetNote: Why nested deserialization is harmful: Magento XXE (CVE-2024-34102)
AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis for CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Adobe) Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability in Adobe Commerce. Apparently CVE-2024-34102 is dubbed #CosmicSting by Sansec. AssetNote thinks the vulnerability is severe due to the following reasons:

  • It is possible to exfiltrate the app/etc/env.php file from Magento, which contains a cryptographic key used to sign JWTs used for authentication. An attacker can craft an administrator JWT and abuse Magento's APIs as an admin user on affected installations.
  • The vulnerability can be chained with recent research in PHP filter chains leading to RCE through the CVE-2024-2961 exploit
  • The broader impacts of XXE (any local file or remote URL's contents can be exfiltrated).

AssetNote patch diffed to find the root cause, and provides a walkthrough to crafting a proof of concept exploit.

#CVE_2024_34102 #vulnerability #AdobeCommerce #Magento #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-20T23:30:10.701Z ##

@oversecurity @shellsharks Designer vulnerability: "CosmicSting" CVE-2024-34102 9.8 critical, disclosed 13 June 2024 by Adobe Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') allowing for Arbitrary code execution.
Origin of designer name by Sansec:CosmicSting attack threatens 75% of Adobe Commerce stores

#CVE_2024_34102 #Adobe #CosmicSting #vulnerability #CVE #designervulnerabilities

foresightcyber@techhub.social at 2024-06-26T18:05:26.000Z ##

🔒🚨 Wi-Fi Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2024-30078! 🚨🔒

Attention everyone! A critical Wi-Fi vulnerability, CVE-2024-30078, was patched during this month’s Patch Tuesday. However, many Windows machines are still at risk as they remain unpatched.

⚠️ Why this matters:
Exploits for this vulnerability are already being sold by threat actors.
This vulnerability allows attackers to gain control over your machine.
At Foresight Cyber, we pride ourselves on providing top-notch patch management. Most of our customers are already protected, thanks to our timely updates. For those who haven't updated yet, we’ve sent out urgent notifications.

Have you updated your systems? If not, don't wait! Contact us immediately for assistance.

🔧💻 Stay secure, stay protected. Reach out to us now for expert help in securing your network!

#CyberSecurity #PatchTuesday #WiFiVulnerability #CVE202430078 #StaySafe #UpdateNow

##

CVE-2024-30103
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-11T18:30:56

1 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-22T12:36:09.000Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber performed patch diffing and root cause analysis on the Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-30103 (see parent toot for links) and stated the following:

  • It requires valid credentials of the target user to exploit. This is important to know because there is a lot of posting calling this a 'zero-click' exploit and while it might be true to an extent, you still need to be able to create a Form in the target users Outlook client, which requires authorization.
  • It's a bypass for a previously patched vulnerability (CVE-2024-21378)
  • Indicators of exploitation may include a suspicious DLL loaded in the Outlook.exe process, suspicious outbound connections from Outlook.exe and spawned child processes.
  • Exploitation is less likely at a large scale given that an attacker would need a user's credentials to set the attack up. Applying the latest patches is the best way to defend against this exploit.

View the original message at the bad site: https://twitter.com/RobelCampbell/status/1804171069558755624 cc: @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_30103 #CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft

CVE-2024-21412
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:08

2 posts

Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/lsr00ter/CVE-2024-21412_Water-Hydra

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T21:36:30.284Z ##

SonicWall: A Deep Dive Into DarkME Rat Malware
SonicWall provides a technical analysis of DarkME RAT malware. They only mention CVE-2024-21412 once: It is a Microsoft Windows Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVSSv3.1: 8.1 high severity) leveraged by the financially motivated Water Hydra (DarkCasino) APT during a a spike in DarkME RAT distribution in February 2024. While SonicWall describes the infection chain and the RAT's features, they do NOT provide IOC. I'm not going to handjam the SHA256 from a VirusTotal screenshot.

#Darkme #DarkGate #WaterHydra #DarkCasino #APT #malwareanalysis #CVE_2024_21412 #threatintel

CVE-2024-20666
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:06

2 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

2 repos

https://github.com/invaderslabs/CVE-2024-20666

https://github.com/nnotwen/Script-For-CVE-2024-20666

avoidthehack at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.473Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows “0x80070643 error” introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

#security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fake-it-support-sites-push-malicious-powershell-scripts-as-windows-fixes/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T19:25:14.000Z ##

Fake #IT support sites push malicious #PowerShell scripts as #Windows fixes

Threat actors are creating fake tech support sites, promoting them via compromised YouTube creator accounts. These fake sites instruct users to run (malicious) PowerShell scripts that call information-stealing malware.

Specifically, threat actors are targeting the Windows “0x80070643 error” introduced after #Microsoft addressed a BitLocker encryption bypass flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-20666) - affected users are actively searching for fixes, which may lead to stumbling upon these fake sites.

CVE-2024-31484
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T12:32:08

2 posts

A vulnerability has been identified in CPC80 Central Processing/Communication (All versions < V16.41), CPCI85 Central Processing/Communication (All versions < V5.30). The affected device firmwares contain an improper null termination vulnerability while parsing a specific HTTP header. This could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process or lead to denial of service co

jbhall56 at 2024-06-26T12:26:18.305Z ##

One of the security holes, CVE-2024-31484, is a buffer overread issue that can be exploited to read sensitive data from memory, which can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the current process or to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. https://www.securityweek.com/siemens-sicam-vulnerabilities-could-facilitate-attacks-on-energy-sector/

##

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:59

2 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

7 repos

https://github.com/mattaperkins/FIX-CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/exfil0/test_iconv

https://github.com/rvizx/CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/ambionics/cnext-exploits

https://github.com/kjdfklha/CVE-2024-2961_poc

https://github.com/absolutedesignltd/iconvfix

https://github.com/tnishiox/cve-2024-2961

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T14:03:42.391Z ##

AssetNote: Why nested deserialization is harmful: Magento XXE (CVE-2024-34102)
AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis for CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Adobe) Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability in Adobe Commerce. Apparently CVE-2024-34102 is dubbed #CosmicSting by Sansec. AssetNote thinks the vulnerability is severe due to the following reasons:

  • It is possible to exfiltrate the app/etc/env.php file from Magento, which contains a cryptographic key used to sign JWTs used for authentication. An attacker can craft an administrator JWT and abuse Magento's APIs as an admin user on affected installations.
  • The vulnerability can be chained with recent research in PHP filter chains leading to RCE through the CVE-2024-2961 exploit
  • The broader impacts of XXE (any local file or remote URL's contents can be exfiltrated).

AssetNote patch diffed to find the root cause, and provides a walkthrough to crafting a proof of concept exploit.

#CVE_2024_34102 #vulnerability #AdobeCommerce #Magento #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T14:03:42.000Z ##

AssetNote: Why nested deserialization is harmful: Magento XXE (CVE-2024-34102)
AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis for CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Adobe) Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability in Adobe Commerce. Apparently CVE-2024-34102 is dubbed #CosmicSting by Sansec. AssetNote thinks the vulnerability is severe due to the following reasons:

  • It is possible to exfiltrate the app/etc/env.php file from Magento, which contains a cryptographic key used to sign JWTs used for authentication. An attacker can craft an administrator JWT and abuse Magento's APIs as an admin user on affected installations.
  • The vulnerability can be chained with recent research in PHP filter chains leading to RCE through the CVE-2024-2961 exploit
  • The broader impacts of XXE (any local file or remote URL's contents can be exfiltrated).

AssetNote patch diffed to find the root cause, and provides a walkthrough to crafting a proof of concept exploit.

#CVE_2024_34102 #vulnerability #AdobeCommerce #Magento #CVE

##

CVE-2024-28995
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 34.34%

updated 2024-06-06T09:30:52

1 posts

SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

Nuclei template

8 repos

https://github.com/Stuub/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/huseyinstif/CVE-2024-28995-Nuclei-Template

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/ggfzx/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/0xc4t/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/krypton-kry/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/Praison001/CVE-2024-28995-SolarWinds-Serv-U

https://github.com/karkis3c/cves

todb@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-23T15:07:43.000Z ##

@securityaffairs I would love to see some evidence of attackers who are either:

a) reading secret system files that are useful to attackers, like secret credentials, then using them to gain real RCE access, or

b) reading other Serv-U user files since the point of Serv-U is to provide secure file transfer

Something beyond mere scanning by running the neutered public PoCs.

(a) should be easy and universal to automate, and to spot by log checking, while (b) is probably more monetizable, but will be site-specific.

I’m kind of surprised nobody’s actually been popped by CVE-2024-28995 yet. It’s easy to exploit, scanning activity abounds, and if you run it, you should patch, immediately.

But I’m not seeing any reports of real harm yet.

##

CVE-2024-28999
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.70%

updated 2024-06-04T15:31:07

1 posts

The SolarWinds Platform was determined to be affected by a Race Condition Vulnerability affecting the web console.

1 repos

https://github.com/HussainFathy/CVE-2024-28999

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T13:46:49.000Z ##

0xSphinx: CVE-2024–28999 SolarWinds Race Condition
I was wondering what the race condition vulnerability entailed in CVE-2024-28999. See parent toot above for SolarWinds security advisory.

The vulnerability arises due to inadequate synchronization mechanisms during the authentication process. When multiple requests for login authentication are received concurrently, the system fails to properly handle, leading to brute force users even when the right “AccountLockoutThreshold” is configured, a malicious user can use a dictionary “words list” to be able to brute force into any account.

Poroof of Concept located here: https://github.com/HussainFathy/CVE-2024-28999

#CVE_2024_28999 #SolarWinds #CVE #vulnerability #proofofconcept #poc

CVE-2024-5565
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T15:15:52

4 posts

The Vanna library uses a prompt function to present the user with visualized results, it is possible to alter the prompt using prompt injection and run arbitrary Python code instead of the intended visualization code. Specifically - allowing external input to the library’s “ask” method with "visualize" set to True (default behavior) leads to remote code execution.

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-28T00:00:03.000Z ##

｢ Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed a high-severity security flaw in the VannaAI library that could be exploited to achieve remote code execution vulnerability via prompt injection techniques. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5565 (CVSS score: 8.1), relates to a case of prompt injection in the "ask" function that could be exploited to trick the library into executing arbitrary ｣

https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/prompt-injection-flaw-in-vanna-ai.html

##

CVE-2024-3833(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-12T05:04:00

4 posts

Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.939Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-21378
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-04-21T05:02:41

1 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-21378

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-22T12:36:09.000Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber performed patch diffing and root cause analysis on the Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-30103 (see parent toot for links) and stated the following:

  • It requires valid credentials of the target user to exploit. This is important to know because there is a lot of posting calling this a 'zero-click' exploit and while it might be true to an extent, you still need to be able to create a Form in the target users Outlook client, which requires authorization.
  • It's a bypass for a previously patched vulnerability (CVE-2024-21378)
  • Indicators of exploitation may include a suspicious DLL loaded in the Outlook.exe process, suspicious outbound connections from Outlook.exe and spawned child processes.
  • Exploitation is less likely at a large scale given that an attacker would need a user's credentials to set the attack up. Applying the latest patches is the best way to defend against this exploit.

View the original message at the bad site: https://twitter.com/RobelCampbell/status/1804171069558755624 cc: @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_30103 #CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.75%

updated 2024-04-19T05:07:56

2 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

4 repos

@4Dgifts @wdormann I think log4j just from the bonkers exploitability surface area. Somebody just drops some jndi string into a device name or form field and some system far removed just goes to grab some Java class & runs it. I also really liked the creativity in CVE-2023-38408 (OpenSSH ssh-agent RCE); but if the Qualys folks write anything up, it just makes me smile.

##

CVE-2024-0815
(9.3 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

2 posts

Command injection in paddle.utils.download._wget_download (bypass filter) in paddlepaddle/paddle 2.6.0

david_zwei@chaos.social at 2024-07-01T10:35:42.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-0815

An einem Update wird gearbeitet.

CVE-2024-21626
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.06%

updated 2024-02-20T19:26:11

2 posts

### Impact In runc 1.1.11 and earlier, due to an internal file descriptor leak, an attacker could cause a newly-spawned container process (from `runc exec`) to have a working directory in the host filesystem namespace, allowing for a container escape by giving access to the host filesystem ("attack 2"). The same attack could be used by a malicious image to allow a container process to gain access

CVE-2024-23652
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-01T17:48:28

2 posts

### Impact A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using `RUN --mount` could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing `RUN --mount`

1 repos

https://github.com/abian2/CVE-2024-23652

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-06-26T18:05:08.000Z ##

This article discusses a critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-23652) in Docker Buildkit = v0.12.4, which allows arbitrary file deletion in the host OS

Mitigation involves updating to Buildkit v0.12.5 or later

➜ https://dev.to/snyk/buildkit-build-time-container-teardown-arbitrary-delete-cve-2024-23652-2kkh

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

#threatintel #activeexploitation #eitw #botnet #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T22:54:56.844Z ##

GreyNoise: Perma-Vuln: D-Link DIR-859, CVE-2024-0769
D-Link is the gift that keeps on giving: GreyNoise reports that CVE-2024-0769 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 January 2024) D-Link DIR-859 WiFi router path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) to information disclosure vulnerability is being exploited in the wild (cc: @todb):

the product is End-of-Life (EOL) meaning it will never recieve a patch.
While the exploit conditions are the same as the public PoC, the variation as observed by GreyNoise is dumping all name, password, group, and description for all users of the device.

#CVE_2024_0769 #Dlink #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T22:54:56.000Z ##

GreyNoise: Perma-Vuln: D-Link DIR-859, CVE-2024-0769
D-Link is the gift that keeps on giving: GreyNoise reports that CVE-2024-0769 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 January 2024) D-Link DIR-859 WiFi router path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) to information disclosure vulnerability is being exploited in the wild (cc: @todb):

the product is End-of-Life (EOL) meaning it will never recieve a patch.
While the exploit conditions are the same as the public PoC, the variation as observed by GreyNoise is dumping all name, password, group, and description for all users of the device.

#CVE_2024_0769 #Dlink #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##
avoidthehack at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.408Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-d-link-dir-859-router-flaw-to-steal-passwords/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T20:55:12.000Z ##

#Hackers exploit critical D-Link DIR-859 router flaw to steal passwords

Threat actors are using slight variations of the publicly available exploit code for CVE-2024-0769 to extract account details from the router.

This could lead to compromise of the router.

Note: this particular router model has reached end-of-life according to D-Link.

This highlights the importance of not using end-of-life devices or software where possible. Depending on the router model, when it is end-of-life, you may be able to flash it with opensource firmware to extend its life. This isn't always possible, though, and users are advised to get a new(er) device ASAP.

#security #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-d-link-dir-859-router-flaw-to-steal-passwords/

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T15:41:06.189Z ##

Fortinet: MerkSpy: Exploiting CVE-2021-40444 to Infiltrate Systems
Fortinet reports on a new Windows spyware dubbed MerkSpy, whose infection chain leverages CVE-2021-40444 (7.8 high, disclosed 07 September 2021, added to CISA KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft MSHTML Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. MerkSpy is capable of keystroke logging, screenshot capture, and harvesting Chrome browser login data. Fortinet describes the attack chain and provides IOC.

#threatintel #merkspy #ioc #CVE_2021_40444

A certain 5400 RPM OEM hard drive, as shipped with laptop PCs in approximately 2005, allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (device malfunction and system crash) via a resonant-frequency attack with the audio signal from the Rhythm Nation music video.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

#threatintel #activeexploitation #eitw #botnet #IOC

EPSS: 95.62%

updated 2023-06-21T05:01:16

8 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.1.0.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3, IIOP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to cri

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer - CVE-2017-3506 and CVE-2023-21839 https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/f/water-sigbin-xmrig.html @trendmicro #cybersecurity #Infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:19:41.822Z ##

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
Water Sigbin (aka the financially motivated 8220 Gang) continues to exploit CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy cryptocurrency miners via a PowerShell script. The threat actor employs fileless execution techniques, using DLL reflective and process injection, allowing the malware code to run solely in memory and avoid disk-based detection mechanisms. This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

#threatintel #8220gang #WaterSigbin #cybercrime #cryptomining #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

##

More: #8220 Gang Exploits #Oracle WebLogic Server Flaws for Cryptocurrency Mining https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/8220-gang-exploits-oracle-weblogic.html @thehackernews

This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

##

CVE-2017-17215
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 79.22%

updated 2023-02-02T05:08:25

1 posts

Huawei HG532 with some customized versions has a remote code execution vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could send malicious packets to port 37215 to launch attacks. Successful exploit could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

4 repos

https://github.com/kd992102/CVE-2017-17275

https://github.com/ltfafei/HuaWei_Route_HG532_RCE_CVE-2017-17215

https://github.com/wilfred-wulbou/HG532d-RCE-Exploit

https://github.com/1337g/CVE-2017-17215

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

#threatintel #activeexploitation #eitw #botnet #IOC

##

CVE-2016-20016
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 12.06%

updated 2023-02-02T05:08:14

1 posts

MVPower CCTV DVR models, including TV-7104HE 1.8.4 115215B9 and TV7108HE, contain a web shell that is accessible via a /shell URI. A remote unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands as root. This vulnerability has also been referred to as the "JAWS webserver RCE" because of the easily identifying HTTP response server field. Other firmware versions, at least from 2014

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)

##

CVE-2018-10561
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.08%

updated 2023-02-02T05:03:55

1 posts

An issue was discovered on Dasan GPON home routers. It is possible to bypass authentication simply by appending "?images" to any URL of the device that requires authentication, as demonstrated by the /menu.html?images/ or /GponForm/diag_FORM?images/ URI. One can then manage the device.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

##

CVE-2018-10562
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.42%

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:49

1 posts

An issue was discovered on Dasan GPON home routers. Command Injection can occur via the dest_host parameter in a diag_action=ping request to a GponForm/diag_Form URI. Because the router saves ping results in /tmp and transmits them to the user when the user revisits /diag.html, it's quite simple to execute commands and retrieve their output.

Nuclei template

5 repos

https://github.com/649/Pingpon-Exploit

https://github.com/Choudai/GPON-LOADER

https://github.com/c0ld1/GPON_RCE

https://github.com/ATpiu/CVE-2018-10562

https://github.com/ExiaHan/GPON

#Weblogic #CVE20173506 #CVE201710271 #CVE202321839 #CryptoMining #Cybersecurity #Infosec
