##
LeeArchinal@ioc.exchange at 2024-06-28T14:55:18.000Z ##

Happy Friday everyone!

#Cryptominers and #CVE20173506 is featured in today's #readoftheday! Trend Micro takes us through a riveting tale where the protagonist, #WaterSigbin, abuses a vulnerability in Oracle WebLogic Servers. After exploitation, a Base64-encoded payload is run that drops the initial stage loader named "wireguard2-3.exe", which masquerades itself as a legitimate VPN technology to help with it's defense evasion. It also plays a role in getting the attack to the next stages which involve DLL-reflection, C2 communication, and finally the #XMRig cyrptominer.

Significant details that are included is a scheduled task created for Windows Defender exclusion, some discovery using WMI, and another scheduled task for persistence. As usual, I am not going to spoil it all, go and have a read for yourself! Enjoy and Happy Hunting!

Notable MITRE ATT&CK TTPs (thanks to the authors):
TA0001 - Initial Access
T1190 - Exploit Public-Facing Application

TA0002 - Execution
T1059.001 - Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
T1047 - Windows Management Instumentation

TA0005 - Defense Evasion
T1620 - Reflective Code Loading
T1036.005 - Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
T1562.001 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

TA0003 - Persistence
T1053.005 - Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task

TA0011 - Command And Control
T1571 - Non-Standard Port
T1071 - Application Layer Protocol

TA0007 - Discovery
T1057 - Process Discovery
T1012 - Query Registry

Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/f/water-sigbin-xmrig.html

Intel 471 #CyberSecurity #ITSecurity #InfoSec #BlueTeam #ThreatIntel #ThreatHunting #ThreatDetection #HappyHunting #gethunting

##

CVE-2017-10271
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.41%

updated 2023-02-02T05:00:43

4 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: WLS Security). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.1.0 and 12.2.1.2.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of

Nuclei template

31 repos

https://github.com/testwc/CVE-2017-10271

https://github.com/c0mmand3rOpSec/CVE-2017-10271

https://github.com/Cymmetria/weblogic_honeypot

##

CVE-2006-5051(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 72.45%

updated 2023-02-01T05:01:22

12 posts

Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code if GSSAPI authentication is enabled, via unspecified vectors that lead to a double-free.

1 repos

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-6387

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-07-01T16:45:06.000Z ##

'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems

｢ They have named this vulnerability "regreSSHion", since it represents the re-emergence of a bug that was previously patched in 2006 (CVE-2006-5051). It is described as "critical" ｣

https://www.computing.co.uk/news/4329906/critical-vulnerability-openssh-uncovered-affects-linux-systems

#OpenSSH #regreSSHion #CVE20065051 #SSH #Vulnerability #Infosec #Opensource

'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T13:38:08.837Z ##

OpenSSH security advisory: regreSSHion: RCE in OpenSSH's server, on glibc-based Linux systems (CVE-2024-6387)
CVE-2024-6387 (people are calling this critical without knowing what the CVSS score is) is referred to as #regreSSHion (cc: @shellsharks). Currently trending on social media due to it being dropped this morning.
a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd). if a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default) This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. "This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems ... an unauthenticated remote code execution as root"
This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2006-5051 (9.3 high) "Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code"

#CVE_2024_6387 #openssh

##
briankrebs at 2024-07-01T12:31:54.923Z ##

In case your Monday wasn't stressful enough already, there's a lot of chatter about a newly documented remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-6387) in OpenSSH server.

"Based on searches using Censys and Shodan, we have identified over 14 million potentially vulnerable OpenSSH server instances exposed to the Internet. Anonymized data from Qualys CSAM 3.0 with External Attack Surface Management data reveals that approximately 700,000 external internet-facing instances are vulnerable. This accounts for 31% of all internet-facing instances with OpenSSH in our global customer base. Interestingly, over 0.14% of vulnerable internet-facing instances with OpenSSH service have an End-Of-Life/End-Of-Support version of OpenSSH running."

...."The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems."

"In our security analysis, we identified that this vulnerability is a regression of the previously patched vulnerability CVE-2006-5051, which was reported in 2006."

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/07/01/regresshion-remote-unauthenticated-code-execution-vulnerability-in-openssh-server

##
decio at 2024-07-01T09:44:57.496Z ##

But that's not like me, I'm breaking free
-- The Interrupters, "Haven't Seen the Last of Me" 😁

"This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems,
where syslog() itself calls async-signal-unsafe functions (for example,
malloc() and free()): an unauthenticated remote code execution as root,
because it affects sshd's privileged code, which is not sandboxed and
runs with full privileges. We have not investigated any other libc or
operating system; but OpenBSD is notably not vulnerable, because its
SIGALRM handler calls syslog_r(), an async-signal-safer version of
syslog() that was invented by OpenBSD in 2001.

To exploit this vulnerability remotely (to the best of our knowledge,
CVE-2006-5051 has never been successfully exploited before), we drew
inspiration from a visionary paper, "Delivering Signals for Fun and
Profit", which was published in 2001 by Michal Zalewski"
👇
https://www.qualys.com/2024/07/01/cve-2024-6387/regresshion.txt

#Debian :debian: tracker
👇
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-6387

#CyberVeille #cve_2024_6387

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-07-01T09:40:22.124Z ##

regreSSHion: Remote Code Execution in OpenSSH Server (CVE-2024-6387)

Date: July 1, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-6387

Vulnerability Type: Race Condition

CWE: [[CWE-362]], [[CWE-665]]

Sources: Qualys

Synopsis

A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been identified in OpenSSH's server on glibc-based Linux systems, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, is a regression of a previously patched issue (CVE-2006-5051) and affects OpenSSH versions from 8.5p1 to 9.8p1. It arises from a signal handler race condition in the sshd server, leading to unsafe function calls within asynchronous signal handlers.

Technical Key Findings

The flaw involves sshd's SIGALRM handler, which calls non-async-signal-safe functions like syslog(), potentially leading to a heap corruption and enabling remote code execution. The exploit requires precise timing to interrupt specific code paths, leaving the system in an inconsistent state that can be exploited.

Vulnerable Products

  • OpenSSH versions 8.5p1 to 9.8p1 on glibc-based Linux systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root on affected systems, potentially leading to complete system compromise.

Patches or Workaround

A fix has been implemented in OpenSSH by moving the async-signal-unsafe code to a synchronous context. Users are advised to update to the latest version or set LoginGraceTime to 0 as a temporary mitigation.

Tags

#OpenSSH #CVE-2024-6387 #RCE #RaceCondition #Linux #glibc #SecurityVulnerability #Exploit #Patch

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T13:38:08.000Z ##

OpenSSH security advisory: regreSSHion: RCE in OpenSSH's server, on glibc-based Linux systems (CVE-2024-6387)
CVE-2024-6387 (people are calling this critical without knowing what the CVSS score is) is referred to as #regreSSHion (cc: @shellsharks). Currently trending on social media due to it being dropped this morning.
a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd). if a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default) This race condition affects sshd in its default configuration. "This vulnerability is exploitable remotely on glibc-based Linux systems ... an unauthenticated remote code execution as root"
This vulnerability is a regression of CVE-2006-5051 (9.3 high) "Signal handler race condition in OpenSSH before 4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code"

#CVE_2024_6387 #openssh

In case your Monday wasn't stressful enough already, there's a lot of chatter about a newly documented remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-6387) in OpenSSH server.

"Based on searches using Censys and Shodan, we have identified over 14 million potentially vulnerable OpenSSH server instances exposed to the Internet. Anonymized data from Qualys CSAM 3.0 with External Attack Surface Management data reveals that approximately 700,000 external internet-facing instances are vulnerable. This accounts for 31% of all internet-facing instances with OpenSSH in our global customer base. Interestingly, over 0.14% of vulnerable internet-facing instances with OpenSSH service have an End-Of-Life/End-Of-Support version of OpenSSH running."

...."The vulnerability, which is a signal handler race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd), allows unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) as root on glibc-based Linux systems."

"In our security analysis, we identified that this vulnerability is a regression of the previously patched vulnerability CVE-2006-5051, which was reported in 2006."

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/07/01/regresshion-remote-unauthenticated-code-execution-vulnerability-in-openssh-server

regreSSHion: Remote Code Execution in OpenSSH Server (CVE-2024-6387)

Date: July 1, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-6387

Vulnerability Type: Race Condition

CWE: [[CWE-362]], [[CWE-665]]

Sources: Qualys

Synopsis

A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability has been identified in OpenSSH's server on glibc-based Linux systems, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, is a regression of a previously patched issue (CVE-2006-5051) and affects OpenSSH versions from 8.5p1 to 9.8p1. It arises from a signal handler race condition in the sshd server, leading to unsafe function calls within asynchronous signal handlers.

Technical Key Findings

The flaw involves sshd's SIGALRM handler, which calls non-async-signal-safe functions like syslog(), potentially leading to a heap corruption and enabling remote code execution. The exploit requires precise timing to interrupt specific code paths, leaving the system in an inconsistent state that can be exploited.

Vulnerable Products

  • OpenSSH versions 8.5p1 to 9.8p1 on glibc-based Linux systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code as root on affected systems, potentially leading to complete system compromise.

Patches or Workaround

A fix has been implemented in OpenSSH by moving the async-signal-unsafe code to a synchronous context. Users are advised to update to the latest version or set LoginGraceTime to 0 as a temporary mitigation.

##

CVE-2007-1667(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 6.91%

updated 2023-01-31T05:03:54

2 posts

Multiple integer overflows in (1) the XGetPixel function in ImUtil.c in X.Org libx11 before 1.0.3, and (2) XInitImage function in xwd.c for ImageMagick, allow user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or obtain sensitive information via crafted images with large or negative values that trigger a buffer overflow.

janl@narrativ.es at 2024-06-26T16:37:25.000Z ##

It’s not fair because I’ve only done a handful and my colleagues sent literally dozens of CVE clarifications to NIST, but one of mine got published already: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1667#VulnChangeHistorySection

Background level 1: we are currently triaging old and new CVEs for correctness for Yocto specifically, but this being Linux packages, they will benefit all distros.

Background level 2: ImageMagick was listed as vulnerable because it *uses* libx11, but it does not *vend* it nor does it specifies safe versions.

##
janl@narrativ.es at 2024-06-26T16:37:25.000Z ##

It’s not fair because I’ve only done a handful and my colleagues sent literally dozens of CVE clarifications to NIST, but one of mine got published already: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1667#VulnChangeHistorySection

Background level 1: we are currently triaging old and new CVEs for correctness for Yocto specifically, but this being Linux packages, they will benefit all distros.

Background level 2: ImageMagick was listed as vulnerable because it *uses* libx11, but it does not *vend* it nor does it specifies safe versions.

The Windows Graphical Device Interface library (GDI32.DLL) in Microsoft Windows allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a Windows Metafile (WMF) format image with a crafted SETABORTPROC GDI Escape function call, related to the Windows Picture and Fax Viewer (SHIMGVW.DLL), a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-2123 and CVE-2005-2124, and as originally discovered in the wild on union

##

CVE-2021-30561(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2023-01-30T05:01:13

4 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.939Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

CVE-2024-31202

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-30T17:00:01.000Z ##

##
jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-30T17:00:01.000Z ##

☣️ IoT and Healthcare is how we'll remain employed unfortunately.

｢ Disruption of this equipment can have severe real-life consequences, such as the destruction of temperature-sensitive vaccines or contamination of biological samples ｣

https://www.scmagazine.com/news/patchless-temperature-monitor-vulnerabilities-could-leak-patient-data

#IoT #ZeroDay #Healthcare #CVE202431202 #Infosec

##

CVE-2024-34122
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T20:15:17.726Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has five total Chromium-based security advisories. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome blog post disclosing four of the CVE IDs on 25 June 2024. CVE-2024-6290 through CVE-2024-6293 are included by MSRC (note: MSRC got lazy and didn't include the whole description in the title e.g. "Chromium: CVE-2024-6290 Use after free in Dawn").
The new CVE ID is CVE-2024-34122 (7.3 high severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. Interestingly "The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Adobe Software which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based)." The Common Weakness and Enumeration is CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read. It is marked Not exploited, Not publicly disclosed and Exploitation Less Likely.

#CVE_2024_34122 #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #Adobe

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T20:15:17.000Z ##

The new CVE ID is CVE-2024-34122 (7.3 high severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. CVE-2024-31320
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.760Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—July 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

#PatchTuesday #Google #Android #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-01T19:06:29.000Z ##

Google Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—July 2024
29 security vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-31320 (EoP) is marked critical severity. Qualcomm vuln CVE-2024-21461 is also critical. 25 vulnerabilities of varying types are high severity. No mention of exploitation

  • Pixel does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • There are no Android Automotive OS security patches in the July 2024 Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin.
  • Chromecast does not have a July 2024 Bulletin
  • Wear July 2024 bulletin is 404 error.
  • Pixel Watch does not have a July 2024 Bulletin

#PatchTuesday #Google #Android #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-37282
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:04:49.398Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.2 Security Update (ESA-2024-18)
CVE-2024-37282 (8.1 high) ECE Improper Authorization. It was identified that under certain specific preconditions, an API key 2 that was originally created with a specific privileges could be subsequently used to create new API keys that have elevated privileges.

Affected ECE versions after 3.0.0 and before 3.7.2. Users should upgrade to version 3.7.2. No mention of exploitation

#CVE_2024_37282 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-28T11:04:49.000Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.2 Security Update (ESA-2024-18)
CVE-2024-37282 (8.1 high) ECE Improper Authorization. It was identified that under certain specific preconditions, an API key 2 that was originally created with a specific privileges could be subsequently used to create new API keys that have elevated privileges.

Affected ECE versions after 3.0.0 and before 3.7.2. Users should upgrade to version 3.7.2. No mention of exploitation

#CVE_2024_37282 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-2177
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.695Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T14:32:07.076Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds 3 to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2022-24816 (9.8 criutical) GeoSolutionsGroup JAI-EXT Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-2586 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-13965 (6.1 medium) Roundcube Webmail Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability

CVE-2024-31317
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-06-24T14:17:11.000Z ##

Plus, Android's app security model makes it less likely for the database to be exfiltrated even if unencrypted (you can't access other apps' private data directories in the internal storage without superuser [which isn't available to apps by default] or an exploit), at least compared to Windows, though it should still be encrypted due to the possibility of exploits like CVE-2024-31317 existing.

##
